intro: Apargia setosa, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, with both male and female flowers present on the same plant. Apargia setosa is often found in rich, loamy soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
